CV Reach out

I do
Computer Science
and open-source.

I like maths, logic, and good software. Also, talk to me about cognitive science and information theory.

Most of my work happens on GitHub.

Teaching is fun.

Discrete Probability Theory

Teaching materials for Discrete Probability Theory at TUM from my revision course in 2020 (undergraduate).

 Functional Programming and Verification

Teaching materials for Functional Programming and Verification at TUM from my revision course in 2020 (undergraduate).

 Theoretical Computer Science

Teaching materials for Theoretical Computer Science at TUM (undergraduate).

Projects.

Tony

A functional, strongly typed, high level, general purpose programming language. Tony employs refinement types, allowing its type checker to catch domain-specific bugs at compile time.

 Plaain

A serverless web app to organize and stream media from anywhere.

 bifolia

Website of the landscape architecture firm "bifolia".

 Propose

A simple language implemented in Python to quickly generate truth tables of propositional logic formulae from the command line.

Some libraries.

acts_as_favoritor

Adds Favorite, Follow, Vote, etc. functionality to ActiveRecord models.

 turbolinks-animate

A JavaScript library to add rich & adaptive animations to apps using Turbolinks.

 notifications-rails

A flexible notification library supporting the delivery to external services, rendering in various environments, and user configuration by category.

Reach out to me with things you find exciting.
